001package imagingbook.pub.color.quantize;
002
003import java.awt.image.IndexColorModel;
004
005import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
006import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
007import imagingbook.lib.color.Rgb;
008
009public abstract class ColorQuantizer {
010        
011        protected final static int MAX_RGB = 255;
012        
013        /**
014         * Retrieves the color map produced by this color quantizer.
015         * The returned array is in the format int[idx][rgb], where
016         * rgb = 0 (red), 1 (green), 2 (blue) and  0 &le; idx &lt; nColors.
017         * This method must be implemented by any derived concrete class.
018         * 
019         * @return The table of quantization colors.
020         */
021        public abstract int[][] getColorMap();
022        
023        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
024        
025        /**
026         * Performs color quantization on the given full-color RGB image
027         * and creates an indexed color image.
028         * 
029         * @param cp The original full-color RGB image.
030         * @return The quantized (indexed color) image.
031         */
032        public ByteProcessor quantize(ColorProcessor cp) {
033                int[][] colormap = this.getColorMap();
034                if (colormap.length > 256) 
035                        throw new Error("cannot index to more than 256 colors");
036                int w = cp.getWidth();
037                int h = cp.getHeight();
038                int[]  rgbPixels = (int[]) cp.getPixels();
039                byte[] idxPixels = new byte[rgbPixels.length];
040
041                for (int i = 0; i < rgbPixels.length; i++) {
042                        idxPixels[i] = (byte) this.findColorIndex(rgbPixels[i]);
043                }
044
045                IndexColorModel idxCm = makeIndexColorModel(colormap);
046                return new ByteProcessor(w, h, idxPixels, idxCm);
047        }
048        
049        private IndexColorModel makeIndexColorModel(int[][] colormap) {
050                final int nColors = colormap.length;
051                byte[] rMap = new byte[nColors];
052                byte[] gMap = new byte[nColors];
053                byte[] bMap = new byte[nColors];
054                for (int i = 0; i < nColors; i++) {
055                        rMap[i] = (byte) colormap[i][0];
056                        gMap[i] = (byte) colormap[i][1];
057                        bMap[i] = (byte) colormap[i][2];
058                }
059                return new IndexColorModel(8, nColors, rMap, gMap, bMap);
060        }
061        
062        /**
063         * Performs color quantization on the given sequence of
064         * ARGB-encoded color values and returns a new sequence 
065         * of quantized colors.
066         * 
067         * @param origPixels The original ARGB-encoded color values.
068         * @return The quantized ARGB-encoded color values.
069         */
070        public int[] quantize(int[] origPixels) {
071                int[] qantPixels = new int[origPixels.length];
072                for (int i = 0; i < origPixels.length; i++) {
073                        qantPixels[i] = quantize(origPixels[i]);
074                }
075                return qantPixels;
076        }
077        
078        /**
079         * Performs color quantization on the given ARGB-encoded color 
080         * value and returns the associated quantized color. 
081         * @param p The original ARGB-encoded color value.
082         * @return The quantized ARGB-encoded color value.
083         */
084        public int quantize(int p) {
085                int[][] colormap = getColorMap();
086                int idx = findColorIndex(p);
087                int red = colormap[idx][0];
088                int grn = colormap[idx][1];
089                int blu = colormap[idx][2];
090                return Rgb.rgbToInt(red, grn, blu);
091        }
092        
093        /**
094         * Finds the color table index of the color that is "closest" to the supplied
095         * RGB color (minimum Euclidean distance in color space). 
096         * This method may be overridden by inheriting classes, for example, to use
097         * quick indexing in the octree method.
098         *  
099         * @param p Original color, encoded as an ARGB integer.
100         * @return The associated color table index.
101         */
102        protected int findColorIndex(int p) {
103                int[][] colormap = getColorMap();
104                int[] rgb = Rgb.intToRgb(p);
105                int n = colormap.length;
106                int minD2 = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
107                int minIdx = -1;
108                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
109                        final int red = colormap[i][0];
110                        final int grn = colormap[i][1];
111                        final int blu = colormap[i][2];
112                        int d2 = sqr(red - rgb[0]) + sqr(grn - rgb[1]) + sqr(blu - rgb[2]);     // dist^2
113                        if (d2 < minD2) {
114                                minD2 = d2;
115                                minIdx = i;
116                        }
117                }
118                return minIdx;
119        }
120        
121        public void listColorMap() {
122                int[][] colormap = getColorMap();
123                int n = colormap.length;
124                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
125                        int red = 0xff & colormap[i][0];
126                        int grn = 0xff & colormap[i][1];
127                        int blu = 0xff & colormap[i][2];
128                        System.out.println(String.format("i=%3d: r=%3d g=%3d b=%3d", i, red, grn, blu));
129                }
130        }
131        
132        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
133        
134        protected int log2(int n){
135                if(n <= 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException();
136                return 31 - Integer.numberOfLeadingZeros(n);
137        }
138        
139        protected int sqr(int k) {
140                return k * k;
141        }
142
143}
